title: India's Wrestling Dream Takes Shape:  Vinesh, Anshu, Reetika Secure Paris 2024 Olympic Quotas
content:
India's hopes for success at the Paris 2024 Olympics have taken a significant step forward with Vinesh Phogat, Anshu Malik, and Reetika Hooda securing three Olympic quotas in wrestling at the Asian Olympic Qualifiers in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan.

The three wrestlers displayed dominant performances, securing victories in their respective weight categories.  Phogat, Malik, and Hooda join Antim Panghal, who earned a quota in the 53kg category last year, bringing India's total to four Olympic berths in women's wrestling. 

This achievement comes as a major boost for Indian wrestling, which has been grappling with internal turmoil and controversy in recent months.
author: Scroll Staff
